p: A family of CHDP with particularly potent activity against human viral pathogens is the cecropins. These peptides, identified initially in the Cecropia moth ( Hyalophoracecropia) form part of the immune response to infection in a number of insect orders including Diptera and Lepidoptera, and are typically 30â€“39 amino acids in size (Boman 1991). Cecropin and cecropin-like peptides are a highly conserved, predominantly alpha helical group of peptides that have broad spectrum antibacterial and antifungal activity (Bulet and Stocklin 2005).
